content.raw: Again, explicitly requesting that qtbase5-dev and libgles2-mesa-dev be installed resolves this issue. I’m not familiar with the details of the packages, but if I’m understanding @ikigai_sudo correctly it seems that these particular dependencies are getting dropped off the dependencies list for some reason. I’m still unsure what would cause that, and as a result I’m not quite sure whether to alter the Dockerfile to fix the issue. @caguero do you have a suggestion?
content.html: Again, explicitly requesting that qtbase5-dev and libgles2-mesa-dev be installed resolves this issue. I’m not familiar with the details of the packages, but if I’m understanding @ikigai_sudo correctly it seems that these particular dependencies are getting dropped off the dependencies list for some reason. I’m still unsure what would cause that, and as a result I’m not quite sure whether to alter the Dockerfile to fix the issue. @caguero do you have a suggestion?
